column2: As the reigning [Root.GetTitle] you are expected to lead the realm in all matters of statecraft and war, the weight of this task is immense.
As you complete your investiture the great authority in all matters of state are laid upon your shoulders. Are you truly prepared to lead the realm?
You are a Weakling, dominated by the princes and members of court who regard you as nothing more than a plaything for their use.
What must I do?  Perhaps this is my place...
You are no longer considered a weakling. The more ambitious members of court have noted this and make moves to ensure you stay their plaything.
I will prove myself greater than these serpents and jackals.
You are a Figurehead Ruler, a puppet to the princes of the council and made hostage within the choking luxury of the royal quarter.
The shame, the shame of it all...
You are free from the machinations of your court, but still the webs of intrigue hang around you.
Still, it is great to be heard by ones people!
As you gain more influence in the affairs of court, those formerly smug serpents whisper your name in fear as they observe your ascension.
Closer and closer, every day...

You are an undisputed master of the palace, the army, and the vast lands of your realm. Your courtiers look to you for leadership in all affairs, and it is only in hushed tones and cloistered alcoves that any dare speak ill of you.
It is good to be the [Root.GetTitle]!
Current Imperial Authority
The council is disgusted
The council was turned against you
The council now despises you
Writing Furiously
Done Poorly
Done Well
Done Exceptionally Well
An administrator has proved themselves a shining star of loyalty, you reap the fruits of his labor in the eyes of the aristocracy.
Excellent!
A Courtly Retainer has graciously announced his support for you and your policies during a recent assembly.
The opinion of the council against you is charitable and it appears that they do indeed respect your decrees...
After your latest victory for the realm you are held in glowing esteem by the venerable princes of the realm and their retainers.
You have led the Princes of the realm into glorious victory over the enemy, all men lavish you with great praise and shout "Hail the [Root.GetTitle], finest of Princes and trampler of our enemies!".
A disloyal worm of an administrator has made it their goal to limit your authority, this has reflected badly upon you in the eyes of the aristocracy.
Disappointing...
A Courtly Retainer has been deriding your policies and insulting your name during a recent assembly!
The actions of the disloyal council have left you confused and frustrated, it appears your grasp on day-to-day business is waning.
After your latest defeat the realm was left reeling as your subjects and the princes begin to question your very position of Rulership.
Your dead lie thick upon the earth, the princes and widows of the realm shudder at this great defeat and declare, "Truly, he is no [Root.GetTitle], but a gutless worm!".
The ascension of a new [Root.GetTitle] is always difficult as the court decides whether or not they should heed to your decrees.
I will rain honor upon the heads of my house. So sayeth I.
For shame, due to circumstances outside your control a regent must manage the realm in your place...
You won a Great Triumph for your realm! Your subjects come to you lavishing praise, you can see your council approve of this very much, Its good to be the [Root.GetTitle].

Vultures! You return to your realm defeated and humilated. Your subjects come to you insulting and ungrateful, you can see your council look at you disapprovingly, you angrily swear under your breath.
A former Governor has decided to raise a stele inscribed with many false accusations against your person in a public square.
This slandering stele is a joke.
Oh please, this entertains me so.
The slandering stele has caused much womanly gossip.
What in... what is this slander?
The slandering stele has caused a great commotion among the aristocracy.
Not another word about this!
The Council does not approve of this subjects slandering of your venerable name
My fair princes...
Your vassal has caused the Council to not approve of you.
Serpents, all of them!
Your vassal has caused The Council to greatly disapprove of you
The dishonor!
This Prince of the Court has just failed to slander your name!
That whinging parasite...
This Prince of the Court has somehow managed to slander your name!
That fetid dog!
This Courtly Subject has not only SLANDERED your name but has trodden upon the honor of your family!
Not just myself, but my blood? Perhaps I will take their eyes...
Switched Devotion
Pray to the gods of the [Root.Religion.GetFullName] pantheon

By praying to the [Root.Religion.GetFullName] pantheon, you wish to gain the blessings of the divines, whether they will recieve your request depends on your devotion to them and their fickle natures.
Request Boon
Request Boon from the Divines.
Make a sacrifice to the Divines
You decide to hold a holy sacrifice to honor and feed the gods.

column1: #call the gods to get boons or curses

column2: You have decided to call upon the gods of the [Root.Religion.GetFullName] pantheon in exultation and loud prayer, you set their images before you and contemplate their majesty.

It begins as a feeling, as when one slowly awakens from a dream. You feel a hand of light pass through you and for an instant you feel the euphoria of a youth in love or a child for their parent. A god has paid notice to you, and now works those many small miracles that improve one’s life. Stretching your limbs, you shout for joy towards the heavens. You are blessed!
Despair! The gods have ignored your request for a blessing, your devotion to them must not have been great enough. What is one to do?

This God can be called in many capacities to service ever facet of their devotees. As a result, while the gods have heard your prayers, it is for you to decide to which of their divine qualities you wish to invoke to be granted their powerful boon...
I call upon Apollon Klutotóxos, Famed Holder of the Glistening Bow...
I call upon Apollon Akestor, The Ever-Young God...
I call upon Athene Promachos, Who fights in the Front-Line...
I call upon Athene Glaukopis, Whose bright-eye glistens in the night...
You hope by making a sacrifice to the gods you are able to placate them and perhaps gain their favors, now it is up to you to decide the scope and grandeur of the ceremony...
You decide on a modest offering to placate the gods.
You decide to invite the necessarys and put on a decent show for the rituals.
HAH, what am I, some poor country physician? Spare no expense!

As ruler, you of course have the option to carry out the sacrifice yourself. The prize bull is led into the throng signalling the beginning of the liturgy and the sacrifice. The priests nod, they are ready to initiate the ritual, you...
...say the prayers yourself and take the knife to the offerings throat.
...decide to let the priests handle it.

You recite the archaic words flawlessly with correct intonation and volume, deftly you slide the razor-thin blade in and out of the bulls neck, it tramps, shudders, and lies down. The oldest priest gives you a strong nod as the initiates frantically bend down to collect the precious blood and start the fire upon  the altar. The gods will be pleased.
For the Glory of the gods, and my house!

The priests cry out the correct exultations as the prize bull is led into the throng. The oldest among them finishes the prayer and without blinking opens the beasts throat with the flint knife. As it thrashes and dies the younger members of the congregation begin to light the altar fire and prepare to joint the bull. A successful sacrifice.
As to be expected...

You turn the sacred words into a stuttering muddle, halfway through you accidently recite a childhood prayer and have to begin again. Your cut was too shallow as well, the nervous bull tosses its head and knocks you to the ground. You shout a blasphemous curse and arise covered in filth and blood, and then the crowd begins to laugh...
Oh, what transgression have I committed? Perhaps it was the wine...

It begins well enough, the prayers were recited more or less correctly by the chosen priest who unfortunately displays the signs of a drunk and nervous man. But as the prize bull is led out it not only trods on an old man's foot but breaks through the crowd and gallops away!
Catch it! Catch it you fools! Gods, the day is ruined!

The day begins horribly, you are gripped with anxiety and nausea arising from a night of feverish half-sleep. You flee the shaded corridors for the garden, where even the wind in your ears seems to mock you and the undersides of shrubs are home to grinning demons. You are accursed by a vengeful god.
How strange are the ways of the gods...
You gather the choicest treasures from the enemy plunder, and offer it to the gods. The flames sweep up to heaven as the warriors raise their spears and beat their shields!
I pillage in the name of [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]!
Devote yourself to a god of the [Root.Religion.GetFullName] Pantheon
The [Root.Religion.GetFullName] Pantheon has many gods to choose from perhaps it is time for you to choose one to devote to...
Devote yourself to another god
The [Root.Religion.GetFullName] Pantheon has many gods to choose from perhaps it is time devote yourself to another...
Dedicate your child to...
Dedicate your child to a god of the [Root.Religion.GetFullName] Pantheon of your choice...
Sacrifice to absolve the Gods' Curse!
Sacrifice to absolve the Gods' Curse which was laid upon you!

You enter the temple complex, cleansed and in the proper garb. The priests of each deity eagerly await your choice of patron, they display the images of their mighty lives and deeds... Now is the time to choose.

You enter the temple complex along with your child, cleansed and in the proper garb. The priests of each deity eagerly await your choice of patron for your young one, they display the images of their mighty lives and deeds... Now is the time to choose.
I devote myself to you oh Lord of the Land of Hatti, Heavenly Sovereign.
I devote myself to you, The Sun of the Earth, fairest of all in Hatti.
I devote myself to you, Exalted Son of Tarhunna, Prince of Hatti
I devote my child to you oh Lord of the Land of Hatti...
I devote my child to you, The Sun of the Earth...
I devote my child to you, Exalted Son of Tarhunna...
You call upon the temple functionaries to allow you access to an altar. So that you may perform the sacrifices needed to appease the gods.
May this offering appease the gods!
Reform Palace Bureaucracy
Reform the palace bureaucracy so that you may govern your realm more effectively...
Has not attempted to reform the bureaucracy for ten years.
Sell Positions within your Palace Bureaucracy
You sell positions in your Palace so that you may enrich yourself.
Has not sold any positions for seven years.
Request Personal Tribute
You can request personal tribute from your vassals.
Your Palace has grown to such an extent it has become pertinent to consider the efficency of your palace council to govern your glorious realm.
You have become a model palace bureaucrat in the eyes of your local community, it has been said that your lieges palace greatly approves of your service to the realm.

Rumors from the Palace has arrived suggesting an outstanding provincial lord is a model of excellency to his people and of your realm. You boastfully praise this lord for his great service for your realm.
As you the palace council grows more powerful, the efficency of your realm increases in kind.

A quality counciller has emerged from your palace council, gracefully orating the day's proceeding with such efficency that you and the other palace officals were stunned by excellent councilor before you.
You are a laughingstock of a bureaucrat to your community, your utter incompetence has been heard by a passing palace offical whom is surely to report bad things to the great lord of the palace.

Rumors from the Palace has arrived suggesting an incompetent provincial lord has mismanage his position in the provinces. You scornfully swear in this lord name for his terrible service to your realm.
As you the palace council grown increasingly weaker, your realm's efficency has suffered in equal proportions.

A weak councilor has made themselves known from within your palace council, bumbling through and causing a ruckus with you and the other palace officals whom lament the depravity of the council. You stand before this laughing stock wearing a stern glare.

You have ascended the throne following the death of the previous Lord of the Palace, Palace officals have yet to determine that your worthiness of the realm so have placed it upon themselves to ignore your decrees and service themselves and thier self-interest.
For Shame, in time this council will heed by words!
With a family member in a position of power, it has shown that deep seated corruption lurks in your palace.
This is most concerning...
A schemeing councilor is now sitting in your palace council where there should be a much better candidate, other councilors whisper about this turn of events.
Vultures! I dare say!

The Enemies are at the gates of your palace and as your glorious seat of government burns your palace officals try desperately in vain to save what little they could of your administration from the seering edge of a torch. You stand dumbfounded as you prepare to flee the burning ruins of your palace.
Oh the horrors may the gods forgive me!

Your Palace is filled with imbeciles that are your so called "Palace Bureaucrats", they have squandered the resources of your realm in bloated inefficency and now your realm's effective adminstration extends barely outside the gates of your capital...
The Horrors!

Whether do to the lavish nature of Palace life or a couple years of mismanagement, the glorious efficency of your council has diminshed. Its not to say that they are imbeciles, your realm after all is still working to meet the needs of you and your subjects.
For Shame!

Whether do to the greak work of your councilors or the management of the realm by your provincial lords, the glorious efficency of your council have begun to make real change in your realm. Its not to say that they are the model of the gods you aspire them to be, but your realm has seen increase prosperity through the hard work of the palace.
There is still much to do...

Your Palace is filled with the throngs of your palace bureaucrats that attend to ever facet of your glorious realm, they have not squandered the resources of your realm investing it to improve the day-to-day lives of your subjects under your glorious name!.
As it should be!

After consulting with the members of the Palace, you have decided to reform the proceeding of the palace life. As a result, you must plan how to allocate the Palace budget to meet the needs of this plan...
The plan as is should be fine, there is no need to spend further!
Perhaps allocating a considerable budget is what I need...
By the grace of the gods, I shall spend a great fortune to reform!

The reforms you were hoping to enact had not materialize, in fact, your palace appears to be less efficent than they were before you attemped your great reforms. You resign yourself to your throne to contemplate what has gone wrong.

The reforms you have enacted has seen some successes in your everday governance of the palace, Palace Officals can be seen taking reforms very well, however, the reforms haven't been as revolutionary as your hoping for...
The reforms you have enacted has seen great success and your palace officals are abuzz with great efficency as your reforms have vastly improve the administrative efficency of your realm!
Become a Stratocrat
As a proud warriors whose blood is filled with the martial spirit of the gods, you can lead your people down a strict martial hierarchy as to fight in glorious combat for your realm!
Rejected being Stratocrat

As a proud warrior it was your choice and honor that you have decided on your own path and rejected the martial blood that courses your veins leading your people down a different path then your birthright.

As your stratocratic traditions evolves it dictates that you must maintain a battle ready army which is paramount to maintain your glorious realm as a result you must always be mindful of your next military venture.
You have become a model warrior to aspire your local community whom idolize your martial prowess, it has been said that your liege greatly approves of your martial service to the realm.

Rumors has reached your ears suggesting an outstanding warrior has become a subject of idolization and inspiration to thier people and of your realm. You boastfully praise this warrior for their great service for your realm.

A quality marshal has emerged from your palace council, informing your council about the their great ability to marshal your subjects to fight for your realm. Thier Energy is rather infectous and brings you and the other councillors into a boisterous cheer! Glory to [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName]!

A quality commander has emerged from your training grounds, Their recounting of their time in glorious battle has inspired the soliders whom form the backbone of your society. Thier Energy is rather infectous and brings you and the other soliders into a boisterous cheer! Glory to [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName]!

You are spineless and misguided warrior of which your local community has come to mock your lack of martial spirit, it has been said that your liege greatly dispproves of your lacking martial service to the realm.

Rumors has reached your ears suggesting an misguided warrior has become a subject of mockery to their people and of your realm. You loudly curse the name of this warrior for thier abysmal service for your realm.

A lacking marshal has emerged from your palace council, informing your council about the their seeming inability to marshal your subjects to fight for your realm. Thier Energy is rather lacking...you and the other councillors exchange disapproving glances at this turn of event!

A lacking commander has emerged from your training grounds, Their recounting of their time in battle has not inspired the soliders whom form the backbone of your society. In fact, many soldiers look at the commander with great annoyance for their glory does not match their supposed deeds. You stand before them disappointed.

Your proud martial society is filled with imbeciles that are your so called "Warriors", they have squandered the resources of your realm in disasterous campaigns and now your realm's preperation for the next glorious campaign is greatly hampered...
The Horrors!

Whether do to a miscalculation or a bad campaign, the glorious martial traditions of your realm has diminshed. Its not to say that they are imbeciles, your realm after all is still well staffed with able body warriors loyal to your realm.
For Shame!

Whether do to the greak work of your generals or your martials rousing speeches, your armies appear to be better equipped and expanding to meet the needs of your realm. Its not to say that they are the strongest force of the known world that you aspire them to be, but your realm has seen increase glory and prosperity to your realm and their mighty warriors.
There is still much to do...

Your Military is not to be trifled with! Your army swell in both spirit and bodies as their glory is well regarded across the known warrior in both admiration and fear by your friend and foe alike. Your military advisors have not squandered the resources of your realm investing it to improve the lives of your subjects under your glorious name! To Arms!
As it should be!
Divine Birthright
You are an offspring of a god and mortal and by your divine benefactor you have certain rights...

You stand before the divine, their eyes locked to yours. You are awed by their splendor, their radiance nearly blinding you as you approach [From.GetName]. Their voice rings out before you like drawing you closer in a brilliant embrace. You accept them, and they accept you...

You hurringly rushed to escape the grasp of [From.GetName], but it is in vain. The divine stands triumphant, your eyes looked to theirs, you quiver as the divine forces themselves upon you. You Gasp...
...By God!

You wondered the halls of the palace wondering why your husband summoned you to the garden. You see him in the center of the garden, your eyes locked to each other. Something about the scene speaks of a divine spark. But your gorgeous husband stands before you beaconing you towards him. He softly whispers "...Fairest [Root.GetFullName] may you gleam like the stars. You are wonderful... and I would like you to embrace me." His hand outstreched as to meet you.

Flattered you took your husband arms, but as you do you began to wonder, was this really your husband? You stare up and instead of your husband it was [From.GetName] embracing you with all of their divine glory.

You politely denied as you wish to retire for the day, suddenly your husband came forth at a speed unexpected, he stood before you eyes locked in lust, you suddently realized for whom stood before you, [From.GetName], dropping his illusions and lunges, you gasp as the world becomes a blur of light and darkness.
I was a fooled, by God!

After a long pursuit you stand before the divine, their eyes locked to yours. You are awed by their splendor, their radiance nearly blinding you as you approach [From.GetName]. Their voice rings out before you like drawing you closer in a brilliant embrace. You accept them, and they accept you...

You hurringly rushed to escape the grasp of [From.GetName], but it is in vain running short of breath and with no escape, you whimper. The divine stands triumphant, your eyes looked to theirs, you quiver as the divine forces themselves upon you. You Gasp...
...By God!

Sometime after your encounter with the divine, you are now ready to bear this divines child. You took great percaution to ensure that this baby would come to this world unscathed for he carries the bloods of the divine! You hold your breath as you welcome this child to this world.

Due to the nature of this child's parentage, they have grown to become a powerful demi-god whose divine blood outcompetes in the best mortals around them. Of perfect health and of a taller stature than his closest peer, you watch as the years roll by. They stand before you a splitting image of their divine parent, you weep. They are now an adult and will make a name for themselves and their birthright. You beacon them forward on their destiny ahead...
Onwards Child!
A Demi-God rises!

Born from a Marriage of a Divine to a mortal woman, a prodigous spawn of divinity now walks the world, [From.TrueFather] presence emunates from this young man as he embarks on his birthright as a divine and a mortal!
Wonders walk amongst us!
I know this person!

column1: ###########Apotheosis Event and Other related Greek Hero Events###########

column2: Visiting the Tomb of a Hero
You desire to visit a tomb of a legendary hero...
A Great Hero was laid to rest in your domain...
It is an honor that I am related...
You grab a handful of trinkets
A Hero has Ascended!

[hero_person.GetDynName] lived a glorious life, truly following the example of [hero_person.Religion.GetHighGodName]. [hero_person.GetSheHeCap] passed on [hero_person.GetDeathDate], and people have long wondered if [hero_person.GetSheHe] would be considered a truely die a hero of [hero_person.Religion.GetGroupName] or not.

In a grand ceremony [bishopric_holder.GetTitledFirstName] has declared [hero_person.GetFirstNameWithNick] as a [hero_person.Religion.GetGroupName] who has indeed ascended in Apotheosis, celebrated by the people of [hero_person.PrimaryTitle.GetName] as well as by the [hero_person.Religion.GetGroupName] world as a whole.  

We can only wish to follow [hero_person.GetHerHis] example, and become truly legendary people in the eyes of [hero_person.Religion.GetHighGodName].
May they rest in glorious peace.

[hero_person.PrimaryTitle.GetName] has seen a boost in the awe strucken masses who come to see the tomb of [hero_person.GetName], local merchants are seen selling emblems bearing the symbol of this prestigous heros lineage and house. Among the crowd a bard with a lyre is seen recanting the legendary deeds of [hero_person.GetName] to a crowd of cheering people. You observe the tomb and decide what you need to do to maintain this hero's legacy.
This Tomb should befit a Hero's Honor!
By [hero_person.Religion.GetGroupName], I shall donate to temples as well!
This Hero has done us a Great Service,I'll make an offering...
Maybe I can pocket a bit of change afterall they were born here...
People of the [local_burial_tomb.province_hero.GetFirstNameWithNick] lets sing their deeds!
I pray that the hero's name will be known for many generations...

Inspired by [hero_person.GetName], you have tried to emulate their great deeds. Many people have already begun to speak highly of you as a potential new protege of the late hero. Whether their feats of cunning or strength , the people of [hero_person.PrimaryTitle.GetName] wonder whether the spirit of the Hero emunates from you...
May I do a fraction of their deeds...

[target_burial_site.GetName] is a well known traveling spot for people wishing to see the tomb of the Hero [target_burial_site.province_saint.GetFirstName]. I have never cared much for the hero [target_burial_site.province_saint.GetFirstName] nor [offended_burial_site_owner.GetTitledFirstName], and an opportunity to grab the valuables of the tomb has offered itself. But is it worth the risk?
No, I rather not offend the gods...
Perhaps I can find something of worth...
Entering the tomb of [target_burial_site.GetName], I began to observe the surrounding guaging the amount of treasures I can plunder for my own gain...
I should pick a few shinies and make haste...
I should plunder this tomb bare!
The Honor Guards of the Tomb have caught wind of your activities as you made a ruckus... Your hands up in the air you curse the gods for your misfortune...
HARK FOR SHAME, I've been caught!
The burial site of The §YHero [target_burial_site.province_hero.GetFirstName]§! at [target_burial_site.GetName] has been plundered, and has been left a complete mess...

My men has come across the burial site of some sort of "hero" for the pathetic [pillaged_hellenic.Religion.GetGroupName] [pillaged_hellenic.GetTitledFirstName]. This could be a chance to show them how we treat their sissy heros.
Take everything of value, and leave nothing behind.
We are not pathetic like them, we will leave it be.
I shall venture to the tomb of a local hero on my way to the holy places! Perhaps I can learn many things from their deeds, as I learn more about the divine's role in our lives?
I shall visit [target_burial_site.province_hero.GetFirstName]
I shall visit [target_burial_site.province_hero.GetFirstName]
I shall visit [target_burial_site.province_hero.GetFirstName]
I shall visit [target_burial_site.province_hero.GetFirstName]
I shall visit [target_burial_site.province_hero.GetFirstName]
I shall visit [target_burial_site.province_hero.GetFirstName]
I shall visit [target_burial_site.province_hero.GetFirstName]
I shall visit [target_burial_site.province_hero.GetFirstName]
I shall visit [target_burial_site.province_hero.GetFirstName]
I shall visit [target_burial_site.province_hero.GetFirstName]
I shall visit [target_burial_site.province_hero.GetFirstName]
I shall visit [target_burial_site.province_hero.GetFirstName]
Traveling along a well kept path along the forested hills of [e_greek_empire.GetName], passing by many Herms as you make your way to the various holy places that dot the serene hillsides.
Onwards I go!

I come across a group of travelers, who are also traveling to [pilgrimage_destination.GetName], to ask for the blessing of  [pilgrimage_destination.province_hero.GetFirstNameWithNick]. Traveling together could be beneficial and safer, though probably somewhat slower.

I come across a group of travelers, who are also traveling to [pilgrimage_destination.GetName], to ask for the blessing of  [pilgrimage_destination.province_hero.GetFirstNameWithNick]. Traveling together could be beneficial and safer, though probably somewhat slower.

I come across a group of travelers, who are also traveling to [pilgrimage_destination.GetName], to ask for the blessing of  [pilgrimage_destination.province_hero.GetFirstNameWithNick]. Traveling together could be beneficial and safer, though probably somewhat slower.

I come across a group of travelers, who are also traveling to [pilgrimage_destination.GetName], to ask for the blessing of  [pilgrimage_destination.province_hero.GetFirstNameWithNick]. Traveling together could be beneficial and safer, though probably somewhat slower.
Friendly company? That sounds like a nice change of pace.
A proper hero forges their own path...

I am suddenly met by a couple of rough looking fellows, as I proceed through the forest. The leader gives me a toothy grin and asking for "donations", for the service he and his men are doing in the forest.
It is probably easier to just pay.
I will show them who needs protection.

The days have been long, but the journey not without joy. By my own estimates, I should be halfway to [pilgrimage_destination.GetName] by now. I am not used to such long travels like these, but it has been a nice change of pace from the palace affairs.
I wonder what awaits me in [pilgrimage_destination.GetName].

I come across a group of caravans, filled with the laughter and joy of a group of traveling bards. As day turns to night, I enjoy the company of the group. A particularly beautiful [Root.GetManWomanOpp] is teasing me, and invites me to stay the night.

I come across a group of caravans, filled with the laughter and joy of a group of traveling entertainers. As day turns to night, I enjoy the company of the group. A particularly beautiful [Root.GetManWoman] is teasing me, and invites me to stay the night.
That sounds like a nice suggestion.
What kind of [Root.GetManWoman] do you think I am?

It has been a long day of traveling, when I come across a burning house. I had hoped to find a place to stay the night, but these people are clearly in dire need of help just stopping the flames from engulfing the entire place.
[Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] calls upon me to help out these poor people.
[Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] calls upon me to continue my journey.
[Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] calls upon me to grab some valuables while they are busy.

The rain is pouring down and I am desperately looking for a shelter, when I come across an small simple temple. A modest priest welcomes me inside, gives me some warm clothes and a hot meal. When he mentions that it probably will not stop raining for a couple of days, I wonder if I have time to wait for that long.
It is better to rest a couple of days.
A real hero would not let weather stop them.
You start feeling ill...

All of a sudden, I find myself in [pilgrimage_destination.GetName] before I know it. It has been a long journey through the wilderness, to once more see people is a nice change. As I walk through the city streets, I compare it to my own lands, and how the people have dealt with their own challenges in these lands. I should find my way to the burial site of [pilgrimage_destination.province_hero.GetName] as quickly as possible, that is what I am here for after all.
I wonder what the tomb will look like.

The whole area is filled with people, looking like they come from all the different corners of [e_greek_empire.GetName]. I see another [Root.Culture.GetName] looking at me, and giving me a small nod before [Root.GetSheHeOpp] disappears in the crowd. I never knew  [pilgrimage_destination.province_hero.GetFirstNameWithNick] was this popular or well known. Though it is stressful, I finally get my moment to stand in front of the gates of the tomb, and feel the shining aura of the hero who resides within.

There is a couple of other travelers around, but they all look relatively local to the area. I walk over to the tomb, and look upon a simple mural of the hero on the wall. as well as a stele commemorating the deeds of the hero. It has been a long journey to get to [pilgrimage_destination.GetName], and I finally get to look upon the glorious burial site of  [pilgrimage_destination.province_hero.GetFirstNameWithNick].

The burial site is completely void of people, not a single soul to be seen. I look around for it, almost sure I am at the wrong place for a moment, and then I see the simple unmarked tomb. It looks overgrown and deserted, and I take some time to tidy the place up before I finally sit down in prayer to [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]. It is almost like  [pilgrimage_destination.province_hero.GetFirstNameWithNick] is here and prays with me.
I will remember this moment for the rest of my life.
Was.. Was this it? What a disappointing end.
What a journey it has been.
Your trip to the tomb has come to an end, as you prepare to see you family in your palace, you contemplate on your time resting upon legends...
It was a good odyssey...
